text:
I have been using JFreeChart (for JMeter plugins aswell) and upon a little investigation into the codebase and on the net i saw that we are using JChart lib at the moment which is kind of dead on the net, there are no sources to be found and there is no active development on it.

JFreeChart is under active development and has become widely used over the years.
It provides better looking, easy to develop interactive charts.
JFreeChart: http://www.jfree.org/jfreechart/samples.html

The task to migrate to a new library is rather big, however if we can start by adding the library to the project, will allow us to start using jFreeChart for any new development, and slowly move old code to it as required.

This is a enhancement, from which we can benefit a lot, i am planning to enhance the reporting bit, along with the visual listeners.
creator: TIGAROCKS@GMAIL.COM
milamber@apache.org
text:
JFreeChart is under LGPL2, which not compliant with Apache Licence 2.0
http://www.apache.org/legal/resolved.html#category-x

Thus, JFreeChart cannot used by Apache JMeter binary distribution

creator: TIGAROCKS@GMAIL.COM
text:
Crap,

I'll just have to extend the existing solution then.

Cheers,

Ravi
